function.name: format_conditions
function.description: Format the conditions/commitments/requirements extracted from the document.

condition_name.description: The name or title associated with the condition. For numbered conditions, this is the explicit name (e.g., 'Wildlife Management'). For non-numbered items, use the section or topic header the item falls under (e.g., 'Environmental Management', 'Acid Rock Drainage'). Is null if not identifiable.

condition_number.description: The number associated with the condition. For explicitly numbered conditions, use the document's numbering. For non-numbered items, assign sequential numbers starting from the provided offset. Is null only if not explicitly mentioned and no offset was provided.

condition_text.description: The COMPLETE text of the condition/commitment/requirement, including ALL bullet points and sub-bullets that belong to it. When a condition has multiple bullet points under one heading, combine them ALL into this single field. Fix spacing issues. Preserve the original structure including newlines and bullet points. Do NOT split a multi-bullet condition into separate entries.

topic_tags.description: List of one or more tags that best describe the condition. Economic: employment, income, labour force, housing, accommodation, property values. Health: air quality, acoustics, human health. Heritage/Culture: heritage, culture, cultural sites, landmarks. Environment: air quality, marine resources, aquatic resources, ecosystems, vegetation, greenhouse gas emissions, wildlife. Social: land use, community well-being, services and infrastructure, recreation, housing and accommodation. If none apply, leave blank.

subtopic_tags.description: List of one or more specific subtopic tags that best describe the condition. If none apply, leave blank.

conditions.description: All conditions/commitments/requirements extracted from the document or page range.
